question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: GenesisRuntimeBuilder::new()] [Gas metering bypass] Can an attacker exploit the zero gas parameters (NativeGasParameters::zeros() and MiscGasParameters::zeros()) used in genesis to execute unbounded computations during genesis initialization, potentially causing denial of service or resource exhaustion? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: GenesisRuntimeBuilder::new()] [Feature flag manipulation] Does the use of TimedFeaturesBuilder::enable_all() create a security vulnerability where features intended to be disabled are enabled during genesis, potentially allowing unauthorized protocol behaviors or bypassing safety checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: GenesisRuntimeBuilder::new()] [Configuration bypass] Can the LATEST_GAS_FEATURE_VERSION constant be manipulated at compile time or through feature flags to enable untested gas charging logic during genesis, leading to consensus inconsistencies across validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: GenesisRuntimeBuilder::new()] [State inconsistency] Since Features::default() is used, can an attacker exploit differences between default features and on-chain features to create divergent genesis states across different nodes, causing chain splits? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: GenesisRuntimeBuilder::new()] [Type confusion] Does the aptos_default_ty_builder() call properly validate type layouts, or can malicious genesis transactions inject invalid type layouts leading to memory corruption during genesis execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: GenesisRuntimeBuilder::new()] [Native function injection] Can the SafeNativeBuilder with unmetered=false flag be exploited to register malicious native functions during genesis that persist after genesis completion, allowing arbitrary code execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: GenesisRuntimeBuilder::new()] [Resource exhaustion] Since native gas parameters are set to zeros, can genesis transactions execute expensive native operations (cryptography, storage) without limits, causing validators to run out of memory or CPU? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: GenesisRuntimeBuilder::new()] [Determinism violation] Are all inputs to aptos_natives_with_builder deterministic across validators, or can environmental differences (system time, randomness) cause non-deterministic native function behavior during genesis? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: GenesisRuntimeBuilder::new()] [VM config manipulation] Can the vm_config returned by aptos_prod_vm_config be modified post-creation to bypass execution limits (max_loop_depth, max_value_nest_depth, max_type_nodes) during genesis? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: GenesisRuntimeBuilder::new()] [Chain ID bypass] Is the chain_id parameter properly validated, or can genesis be run with an incorrect/malicious chain_id that causes incompatibility with the rest of the network? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: GenesisRuntimeBuilder::new()] [Clone semantics] Does RuntimeEnvironment::new_with_config properly initialize all internal state, or can cloning this environment later (line 63) lead to shared mutable state and race conditions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: GenesisRuntimeBuilder::new()] [Feature version mismatch] Can there be a mismatch between LATEST_GAS_FEATURE_VERSION used for natives and vm_config, causing inconsistent gas charging between native and Move bytecode operations during genesis? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: GenesisRuntimeBuilder::new()] [Timed features bypass] Since TimedFeaturesBuilder::enable_all() ignores time-based activation, can this lead to premature feature activation that breaks protocol invariants or consensus rules? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: GenesisRuntimeBuilder::new()] [Memory leak] Does the native_builder with zero gas parameters properly handle resource cleanup, or can repeated genesis attempts leak memory through untracked native context allocations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: GenesisRuntimeBuilder::new()] [Integer overflow] Can the combination of LATEST_GAS_FEATURE_VERSION and zero gas parameters cause integer overflow in gas calculations, potentially wrapping to negative values and bypassing gas limits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: build_genesis_runtime_environment()] [Shared state mutation] Does cloning the RuntimeEnvironment create independent copies, or do clones share internal Arc/Rc references that could lead to unexpected mutation when multiple genesis sessions run concurrently? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: build_genesis_runtime_environment()] [Resource isolation] Can multiple calls to build_genesis_runtime_environment() interfere with each other through shared global state in the RuntimeEnvironment, causing non-deterministic genesis execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: build_genesis_runtime_environment()] [Type safety] Does the clone operation preserve all type safety guarantees of the original RuntimeEnvironment, or can clones have corrupted type caches leading to type confusion attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: build_genesis_runtime_environment()] [Memory exhaustion] Can an attacker repeatedly call this method to clone heavy RuntimeEnvironment objects and exhaust validator memory before genesis completes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: build_genesis_vm()] [Configuration inconsistency] Can the chain_id, features, or vm_config be modified between build_genesis_vm() and build_genesis_runtime_environment() calls, causing mismatched configurations between VM and runtime? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: build_genesis_vm()] [Clone vulnerability] Does cloning self.features and self.vm_config preserve all security-critical settings, or can the clone operation reset important safety flags to default values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: build_genesis_vm()] [State leakage] Can the cloned vm_config contain references to the builder's internal state that persist beyond genesis, allowing post-genesis code to access genesis-only privileges? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: build_genesis_vm()] [Lifetime issues] Are the lifetimes of chain_id, features, and vm_config properly bounded, or can they be accessed after the GenesisRuntimeBuilder is dropped, leading to use-after-free? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: new_genesis_session()] [Session ID collision] Can an attacker provide a malicious genesis_id (HashValue) that collides with transaction session IDs, allowing genesis privileges to leak into regular transaction execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: new_genesis_session()] [Resolver bypass] Does the resolver parameter undergo proper validation, or can a malicious resolver return arbitrary state values during genesis, corrupting the initial chain state? (Critical)
